utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, man, this is really happening. You doin’ okay?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Here comes another contraction.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Let’s pick it up.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right, hold on. I’m gonna drive like we do in India. Get out of my way, you syphilitic dogs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stop that, this isn’t India.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Fine. What do one point three billion people know about having babies?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry. I know you were just trying to help. I love you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I love you, too. We’re good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy? Wake up.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s midnight. Happy birthday.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon. Okay, you can have this back in the morning.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is for you. I was going to wrap it, but touching Scotch tape gives me the heebie-jeebies.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ll put in on the list with peaches and felt. What is this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A functional MRI of my brain. I did Sudoku before they took it so I’d be ripped.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I love it. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And it’s not just an MRI. The orbitofrontal cortex is lit up because I was thinking of you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We seem to be moving on to the annual coitus portion of your birthday festivities.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Is that okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I didn’t put on my come-hither plaid PJ’s for nothing.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You hate Scotch tape, but you love Scotch plaid. You are a mystery.

utterance.speaker: Penny (off)
utterance.content: Guys, wake up. Bernadette’s having her baby.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (off)
utterance.content: Come on, we’re going to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I guess, I guess we should stop.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m afraid so. Childbirth, looming coitus? This is a banner night for female genitals.

utterance.speaker: Midwife
utterance.content: Now I see three of you. Do we know the father, or is this some Mamma Mia nonsense?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m the father.

utterance.speaker: Midwife
utterance.content: Okay, Dad, how far apart are the contractions?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No idea. Ask him.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: 12 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Midwife
utterance.content: 12 minutes? Why are you here?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Aren’t we supposed to get here an hour and a half early?

utterance.speaker: Midwife
utterance.content: This is a hospital, not the airport.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m sorry. It’s our first time.

utterance.speaker: Midwife
utterance.content: It’s okay. This little one will be here before you know it. Do we know what we’re having?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, we’re keeping it a surprise.

utterance.speaker: Midwife
utterance.content: Old school. Nice.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Not that old school. He knows.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You see, I was at the doctor’s office, the folder was right there, so I took a peek.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And talking like this doesn’t make it less creepy.

utterance.speaker: Midwife
utterance.content: Sweetheart, go home. Come back when the contractions are five minutes apart for an hour.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that’s ambiguous. Is it five minutes apart starting at the top of the hour, or five minutes apart starting with the first contraction, so essentially, like, 65 minutes?

utterance.speaker: Midwife
utterance.content: I’m just throwing this out there, but home births are very popular these days.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, what took you so long?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wolowitz might hand out cigars. I had to find my bubble gum cigar so I could join in without looking foolish.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Damn, I need my inhaler.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Just don’t smoke.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I went down the stairs too fast.

utterance.speaker: Penny (answering phone)
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Don’t come to the hospital. We’re headed home.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that was fast. Did she sneeze the baby out?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We showed up too early. We’ll keep you posted.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, well, we’ll talk to you guys later. Bye. She said not to come. It’s gonna be a while.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, first deliveries can be slow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m starting to rethink the Flash onesie I bought this kid.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I found it, but it’s empty.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, it doesn’t matter. We’re not going to the hospital now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Are you sure? I’d really like to.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, should we, uh, head back up?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well while we’re all awake, why don’t we go to a diner or something?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, uh, I don’t know. Sheldon, you don’t want to do that, do you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter what I want. It’s your birthday, you decide.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God. It’s your birthday. Let’s do something fun.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Uh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We could go to a bar.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I can breathe again. Babe, they want to have sex.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, of course. The annual birthday booty spectacular!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s a bit childish, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m sorry, and what flavour is your bubble gum cigar?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Grape. I find it the most mild.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, well, you two go have fun.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If we find my backup inhaler, maybe we can get frisky.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you sexy, wheezy little man.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Do you really need to record this?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’ll be happy I did. Okay, little one, here we are back at home because you weren’t quite ready to come out yet. You wanted to make an entrance. I get it. And here’s your daddy. When he tries to tell you he used to be cool, you can see he wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, enough with the camera.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, this is not for me, this is for the baby. Some day she’s gonna want to see this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry, who’s gonna want to see this?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I, I said she, but lot’s of things are she, boats and cars, whales, like thar she blows!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You’re doing great.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, okay, I’m gonna sign off now. This next part may contain some adult language.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: How could you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We made it this far without knowing, and you’ve ruined it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you guys have no idea how hard it is to know something like this and not say it.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You told me it was a girl, and I didn’t say it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Raj.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You were supposed to keep that to yourself.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. I guess it is hard.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, where were we?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I believe we were kissing like randy teenagers, and your nose was whistling ever so slightly.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, don’t be. You were like a foxy tea kettle.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, shall we start over?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m not sure. Earlier tonight, things began organically, and now it’s feeling forced, like all the Pirates of the Caribbean sequels.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay, that makes sense. I mean, the mood’s a little different now. We, we don’t have to rush.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I know, but just, Leonard and Penny think we’re doing it, and I don’t want to disappoint them.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And the mood continues to change.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, and also, I don’t want to disappoint you. I, you know, come on, it’s your birthday. I can soldier through this.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hold on. I think I might have a little surprise that might help get things back on track.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Intriguing. Is back on track a hint that it has something to do with trains?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because if it did have to do with trains, and you were gonna give…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s not about trains.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not even a cozy sleeper car on the Orient Express?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Stop talking about trains.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Who’s killing the mood now?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Found the backup inhaler, want to have sex?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I didn’t until I heard that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hang on. I’m counting. It’s okay.

utterance.speaker: Raj (off)
utterance.content: Hello. Howard and Bernadette kicked me out because I told them they’re having a girl. Oopsy, I did it again.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Maybe if we’re quiet, he’ll go away.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You’re gonna have to be quieter than that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can I look yet?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: One second. All right, you can open your eyes. I thought I’d let Harry Potter make things hotter.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wowza.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I got a Gryffindor robe for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What, a Gryffindor sleeping with a Hufflepuff? How scandalous. You naughty girl, you went to the Wizarding World theme park without me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I did. Am I in trouble?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, you’re in trouble, you went to Wizarding World without me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Wait, what just happened?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know I’ve been wanting to go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, do you really want to argue with me on my birthday?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, you’re right. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ooh. Happy birthday to me.

utterance.speaker: Raj (off)
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Is this about the baby?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No. People just keep kicking me out everywhere I go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good. Then you’re used to this.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, Bernadette’s water broke.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, everyone to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You have got to be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just try to relax, we’ll be there any minute. Stuart, stop driving like an old man. Speed it up a little.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I’m not an old man, I just can’t see at night.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Here comes another one. Hey, Squinty, the gas pedal’s on the right.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: All right, hang on. If you see any pedestrians, just call ’em out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Howard and Bernadette’s kid might be born on your birthday. How cool is that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This is not how I imagined this day going, I should be with them right now.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, it is their child.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I know that. But to be fair, I’ve spent nine months helping Bernadette get ready for this baby, and Howard spent five minutes conceiving it. And I’m being generous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Five minutes? We must be doing it wrong. It took us hours.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And, and the worst part is that they kicked me out and let Stuart stay.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I understand, but this is a special day for them. Can you just try and let it go?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s right. You know, I just learned Amy went to a theme park without me, but I’m not going to ruin her birthday. I’ll wait, and ruin 24 individual hours sprinkled throughout the year. Boop.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Deep breaths, slow breaths.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m so thirsty. Give me more ice chips.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Sorry. I thought these were room ice chips. I’ll go get some more.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Uh, Stuart, while you’re out there, don’t come back.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, what are we gonna name this kid? Now that we know she’s a girl, it kind of ruins my plan for Wally Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We could name her after your mom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Debbie? No. She hated that name.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Did she have a middle name?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Melvina.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Let’s keep thinking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ah. It sucks that she’s not here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hm. She would’ve been the best grandma.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: She did always have candy in her pocket.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. I was 20 years old before I figured out Tootsie Rolls weren’t naturally warm.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I didn’t know her five minutes and she asked, are you a Milky Way or a Snickers girl?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank God you answered right, we wouldn’t be here today.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s hard to believe Howard’s having a kid.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah. Penny, you’re the one who introduced him to Bernie.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How many times do I have to say I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not just Howard and Bernadette. I mean, look how far we’ve all come.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hmm. You two got married.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon and I are living together.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But if my mom asks, we have bunk beds.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny was a struggling actress when we met, and now she’s a successful pharmaceutical rep.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, you don’t have to say struggling every time. You can just say actress.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Howard went to space.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Bernadette got her doctorate.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, Howard and I are working with the government on our quantum gyroscope.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We’ve all come a long way. There’s a lot to be proud of.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: For God’s sake, just drive in the knife, why don’t you.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What’s your problem?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, you’re all thinking it, I’m the only one who hasn’t done anything worthwhile.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was not thinking it. Although, now that you point it out, it is undeniable.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Raj, if it’s any consolation, I’m no better off than I was ten years ago.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yay, I have a doctorate in astrophysics and I’m every bit as awesome as the pasty-faced owner of a comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Raj, show some compassion. Those are things that we think but don’t say.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey, I’m in a hospital and I’m not the patient. I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Come on, Bernie, breathe. Remember what you learned in birthing class.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I remember thinking this is stupid, and I was right.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Do you want me to get the nurse?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No. If one more person puts their fingers near my uterus, I’m gonna cross my legs and snap ’em off.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve come to peace with my relationship with my parents. That was a big milestone for me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, speaking of personal growth, I recently tried eating Swiss chard. You know, I didn’t swallow it, but Amy said it counted.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Hey. Still a loser or did you turn things around while you were gone?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, Raj, honey, you’re being too hard on yourself. When I first met you, you couldn’t even talk to women. I mean, you couldn’t even talk if one was in the room.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, great, now I can say things like I can’t believe you’re breaking up with me, why are you breaking up with me? Yes, I’ll still help you move.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Anyone else want to try?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I got something. Raj, not everybody could be a dog owner. Oh, what? Did your doggie break up with you too?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, I bought M_Ms at the vending machine and two bags came out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I bought the first one, it didn’t fall.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She’s here, the baby’s here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How’s Bernadette?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Tired, but great. They’re both great.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Does the baby have a name yet?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We have named her Halley.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: – Oh.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, like Halley’s comet.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Exactly. Also like the comet, Bernadette said she’s not gonna have sex with me for another 75 years.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s not a real thing, he’s just joking.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m gonna get back. Thank you for staying up, I can’t wait for Halley to meet her new aunts and uncles and godfather.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You hear that, Stuart? I’ve got a dog and a godchild, you have nothing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, look at all the babies.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Some will be successful, some may be homeless. It’s fun to think about.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Kind of hard to see the names.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm, that one kind of looks like Bernadette.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: They all look the same to me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Guys, she’s my goddaughter, I think I’ll know when I see her. That one.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, that was quite a day.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It was. Bernadette had her baby, I made it to Wizarding World, and now it is time to complete your birthday celebration. Hankius pankius.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was afraid you’d be too tired.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, I just saw a magic train and reported somebody for cutting the line. If that’s not foreplay, I don’t know what is.
